FOTO: India Kembali Dihantui Polusi Udara
04 Nov 2019, 16:53 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia
Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Pemerintah India menyatakan Kota New Delhi berada dalam status darurat sejak 1 November akibat tingkat polusi yang membahayakan kesehatan.


Pemerintah India menyatakan Kota New Delhi berada dalam status darurat sejak Jumat (1/11) pekan lalu akibat tingkat polusi yang membahayakan kesehatan. (Photo by Sajjad HUSSAIN / AFP)



Mereka memutuskan menutup kegiatan belajar mengajar di sekolah hingga 5 November mendatang dan akan dibuka kembali jika keadaan sudah membaik. (Photo by Sajjad HUSSAIN / AFP)



Polusi di New Delhi mencapai puncak pada 1 November disebabkan oleh asap kembang api dalam Festival Diwali dan kabut asap akibat pembukaan lahan di pinggiran kota dan negara bagian di sekitarnya. (Photo by Sajjad HUSSAIN / AFP)



Menurut hasil analisis indeks kualitas udara di Kedutaan Besar Amerika Serikat di New Delhi, tingkat polusi di kota itu mencapai sembilan kali lipat melebihi batas yang ditetapkan Badan Kesehatan Dunia (WHO). (Photo by Sajjad HUSSAIN / AFP)



Kegiatan penerbangan dari dan ke New Delhi sempat dihentikan pada Minggu kemarin akibat kabut asap yang pekat memangkas jarak pandang. (Photo by Sajjad HUSSAIN / AFP)



Kendaraan pribadi dengan mesin bensin dan diesel hanya boleh melintasi New Delhi pada hari-hari tertentu dari 4 sampai 15 November. Kemungkinan mereka akan menerapkan kebijakan ganjil genap. (Photo by Sajjad HUSSAIN / AFP)



Para pejabat kini saling menyalahkan atas kondisi itu. Pemerintah kota menyatakan sudah melakukan segala cara untuk menekan polusi.  Sedangkan pemerintah pusat mengklaim masalah itu dipolitisasi. (Photo by Sajjad HUSSAIN / AFP)



 WHO menyatakan 14 kota di India termasuk dalam daftar tempat paling berpolusi di dunia. (AP Photo/Altaf Qadri)

PHOTO: India is again haunted by air pollution
04 Nov 2019, 16:53 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia
Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - The Government of India has declared that the City of New Delhi has been in an emergency status since November 1 due to pollution levels that endanger health.


The Indian government said the city of New Delhi has been in an emergency status since Friday (1/11) last week due to pollution levels that endanger health. (Photo by Sajjad HUSSAIN / AFP)



They decided to close teaching and learning activities at school until November 5 and will reopen if things have improved. (Photo by Sajjad HUSSAIN / AFP)



Pollution in New Delhi reached its peak on November 1 due to fireworks smoke at the Diwali Festival and smog due to land clearing in the suburbs and surrounding states. (Photo by Sajjad HUSSAIN / AFP)



According to the results of the analysis of the air quality index at the United States Embassy in New Delhi, the level of pollution in the city reached nine times the limit set by the World Health Organization (WHO). (Photo by Sajjad HUSSAIN / AFP)



Flight activity to and from New Delhi was stopped on Sunday due to the thick haze that cut visibility. (Photo by Sajjad HUSSAIN / AFP)



Private vehicles with gasoline and diesel engines can only cross New Delhi on certain days from 4 to 15 November. It is likely they will implement even odd policies. (Photo by Sajjad HUSSAIN / AFP)



Officials are now blaming each other for the condition. The city government says it has done everything possible to reduce pollution. While the central government claims the problem was politicized. (Photo by Sajjad HUSSAIN / AFP)



WHO states 14 cities in India are included in the list of the most polluted places in the world. (AP Photo / Altaf Qadri)
